intro: Calamintha grandiflora var. parviflora, commonly known as narrow-leaved calamint, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It features aromatic, slightly hairy leaves that are typically narrow and lance-shaped. The plant produces small, pale blue to violet flowers arranged in terminal clusters, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its medicinal and aromatic properties, it is often cultivated in gardens and used in herbal remedies.
